revised_title: The Royal Society's Role in the Development of the British Gas Industry
tldr: This article discusses the role of the Royal Society in the development of the British gas industry, focusing on the discoveries of John Clayton and the contributions of William Murdoch and James Watt. Clayton discovered "gas lighting" in the 17th century, while Murdoch later developed and demonstrated coal gas as an illuminant. Watt and Boulton's partnership with Murdoch led to the widespread use of gas lighting in factories during the Industrial Revolution.
